page.title: 06Norbury Hall Farm Hazel Grov
page.content: The farm buildings, which date back to the 17th century, are near the site of the old{Norbury Hall manor house. The farm itself goes back to the 13th century. Mr.Cartwright,the present owner, has farmed there for forty years. There is a 30ft deep well behind the farmhouse and the beams in one of the barns are timbers from an old galleon. He has 25 acres and grows market garden produce. One of his specialities is rhubarb. He sells direct to the public from the farm and does not market his produce. He keeps 2 horses and uses good animal manure to grow his crops. Seedlings are grown in sterilized soil, sand and grit. He spends most of his time pricking out in the greenhouse. Plants are then put in the fields. 40cms apart,190 per row. There are 3 farm cottages,but the family do the farming
